means: 诅咒，咒骂( swear的过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: She was sworn in as head of an interim government in March.
sentence.Network_cn: 她3月份宣誓就任过渡政府首脑。

sentence.Network_en: She was bursting to announce the news but was sworn to secrecy.
sentence.Network_cn: 她急不可待想宣布这个消息，但却发过誓要守口如瓶。

sentence.Network_en: The allegations against them were made in sworn evidence to the inquiry.
sentence.Network_cn: 在调查取得的宣誓证词中对他们提出了指控。

entry.def: Sworn is the past participle of swear .

entry.tran: (陈述、声明)宣过誓的，宣誓证明的
entry.def: If you make a sworn statement or declaration, you swear that everything that you have said in it is true.

example.ex: The allegations against them were made in sworn evidence to the inquiry.
example.tran: 在调查取得的宣誓证词中对他们提出了指控。

entry.tran: (仇敌)不共戴天的,势不两立的
entry.def: If two people or two groups of people are sworn enemies, they dislike each other very much.

example.ex: It somehow seems hardly surprising that Ms Player is now his sworn enemy.
example.tran: 现在普莱耶女士成了他不共戴天的仇敌反倒让人觉得不足为奇了。

means.word_mean: 1. bound by or as if by an oath;

sentences.sentence: "according to an early tradition became his sworn brother"

means.word_mean: 2. bound by or stated on oath;

sentences.sentence: "now my sworn friend and then mine enemy"- Shakespeare

auth_sentence.content: He is sworn in as prime minister in May.
auth_sentence.res_content: He is sworn in as prime minister in May.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He is sworn in as prime minister in May.

auth_sentence.content: Vice President Gerald Ford was sworn in as president.
auth_sentence.res_content: Vice President Gerald Ford was sworn in as president.

auth_sentence.content: Vice-president Mohamed Waheed Hussain Manik is sworn as president.
auth_sentence.res_content: Vice-president Mohamed Waheed Hussain Manik is sworn as president.

means.word_mean: 保证说实话的;宣过誓的

sentences.en: The chief witness was allowed to leave the town only after lodging a sworn statement with the police.
sentences.cn: 主要见证人向警方提交宣过誓的证词后,才可离开市镇。
